script_text:
Dust motes dance in the afternoon light. TOBY (7), wearing
       a oversized camouflage jacket, sits cross-legged on the rug.

       He holds a high-end PROP REPLICA HANDGUN. It looks 
       frighteningly real. He mimics the weight of it, aiming 
       steadily at a framed family photo on the mantel.

                               TOBY
                 (A whisper)
                 Bang.

       The hammer of the prop gun clicks back. He pulls the 
       trigger. A plastic snap echoes in the quiet room.

       Outside, through the window, a DOG BARKS aggressively.
synopsis: Toby practices with a replica handgun
description: Toby sits on the rug, holding a prop replica handgun and aiming at a family photo. He mimics the weight of it and pulls the trigger.
continuity_notes: Prop Replica Handgun -> Generic handguns exist in the catalog, but this one is detailed as a 'high-end' replica. Consider referencing Scene 1 for further detail.: Use exact same model of handgun from Scene 1 | hammer of the prop gun -> clicked back: Functioned as expected | plastic snap (from trigger) -> echoed in quiet room: Produced sound

script_text:
JACK (40s, weary) sits at a weathered picnic table. Laid 
       out on a rag is a BOLT-ACTION RIFLE. 

       The DOG, a large German Shepherd, lunges at the length of its 
       chain, barking at the fence line.

                               JACK
                 Knock it off, Bear!

       Jack slides a cleaning rod through the barrel of the RIFLE. 
       The metallic scrape is rhythmic, cold. He ignores the dog’s 
       distress, focused entirely on the weapon in his hands.
description: Jack sits at a picnic table and works on a bolt-action rifle while his German Shepherd, Bear, barks at the fence line.
continuity_notes: bolt-action rifle -> Matches Sc 1 PROP REPLICA HANDGUN (same type of object): Use Scene 1 Prop Replica Handgun | dog -> Matches Sc 1 DOG (same type of animal): Use Scene 1 Dog | rifle barrel cleaning rod -> Not in Reference Catalog, but logical presence: Purchase or provide similar item | RIFLE -> N/A:  | DOOR (implied by fence line) -> N/A:

flags.note: Physical risks like stunt action may be implied, but none explicitly mentioned.
Animals (GERMAN SHEPHERD) are present on set

script_text:
The sun has dipped lower, casting long, jagged shadows.

       A trash can sits at the curb. Smoke curls from the top. 
       Suddenly, a small burst of orange—a FIRE starts within 
       the discarded papers and debris.

       STUNT SEQUENCE:

       A FIGURE (18) sprints down the sidewalk, pursued by the 
       sound of a distant siren. He reaches a high wooden fence 
       separating the properties.

       He leaps, fingers catching the top rail, but his grip slips 
       on the weathered wood. 

       HE FALLS—a hard, flat-back drop from six feet up. 

       THUD. He hits the pavement with a sickening groan. He 
       scrambles up, clutching his side, as the fire in the trash 
       can flares, licking the side of the fence.


                                               FADE OUT.
synopsis: Fire breaks out in trash can
description: A figure sprints down the sidewalk, pursued by a siren. He leaps over a fence but falls and hits the pavement.
continuity_notes: trash can -> PROP REPLICA HANDGUN (Sc 1): Use a trash can from Scene 1, but consider the size and condition to match this scene. | fire -> FAMILY PHOTO (Sc 1): This is not an exact match, but it's possible that the fire could be lit using a lighter or matches that are similar to those used in Scene 1. | wooden fence -> PICNIC TABLE (Sc 2): Consider using a picnic table from Scene 2 as it's possible that the set dressing department could use a similar piece of furniture to create the wooden fence. | GERMAN SHEPHERD -> DOG (Sc 1): Since this is not an exact match, but it's possible that a German Shepherd or another large breed dog could be used to create the sound of pursuit. | rubbish and debris -> FAMILY PHOTO (Sc 1): Consider using similar rubbish and debris from Scene 1, but adjust quantities and arrangement to match this scene's trash can. | trash can -> Burned: Fire starts within the discarded papers and debris. | wooden fence -> Wetted: Smoke from the fire in the trash can licks the side of the fence.

flags.note: Stunts involving vaulting, jumping, and falling require a Stunt Coordinator.
High-complexity environment with fire and sirens may require additional resources.
